title: Brayan Bello reflects on rough playoff start, enters Red Sox camp with new pitch
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Brayan Bello added a curveball to his repertoire after struggling in the 2025 postseason with a 5.40 ERA in September.
Bello is refining his curveball in collaboration with teammate Ranger Suarez and aims for greater control in the 2026 season.
Bello faces rotation competition from new Red Sox pitchers Sonny Gray and Ranger Suarez and rumors of potential trades.

title: A popular Vermont ski resort is under new ownership
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Smugglers' Notch Resort in Jeffersonville, Vermont, was sold to Bear Den Partners, an independent resort operator.
Bill Stritzler, previous owner for 29 years, will retain an ownership stake; his daughter, Lisa Howe, remains as an advisor.
Bear Den Partners plans to maintain Smugglers' family-centric culture and invest in infrastructure and employee support.

title: Mass. senators push bill that could allow residents to sue ICE agents
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Massachusetts Senate introduces bill allowing residents to sue federal officers for constitutional rights violations.
Bill seeks to address aggressive immigration enforcement by federal agents under the Trump administration.
Proposed legislation does not target immigration officers specifically and preserves qualified immunity for reasonable actions.

title: Six arrested in Springfield drug and gun trafficking busts
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Massachusetts State Police seized firearms, fentanyl, cocaine, and $63,000 during operations in Springfield.
Six individuals were arrested after a four-month investigation into drug trafficking linked to Massachusetts and Puerto Rico.
Authorities confiscated 15 handguns, 6 rifles, 11 magazines, 8.5 kg of cocaine, and 30,000 fentanyl bags.

title: Dropkick Murphys cut ties with Wasserman agency after CEO’s name appears in Epstein files
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Dropkick Murphys parted ways with Wasserman agency after Casey Wasserman's name was found in Epstein-related files.
Emails between Casey Wasserman and Ghislaine Maxwell surfaced, though Wasserman hasn't been accused of any crimes.
Other entertainers, including Chappell Roan and Orville Peck, also left Wasserman amid related controversies.

title: Video: Water pours into South Station from newly renovated ceiling
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: A maintenance worker damaged a sprinkler line at South Station, causing water to pour onto the exterior concourse.
The MBTA isolated the incident and completed the cleanup by the end of the day on Thursday.
The sprinkler incident did not disrupt any train services, affecting only the newly renovated South Station concourse.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a quiz to test knowledge of recent Greater Boston news.
Peter Chianca has been Boston.com's general assignment editor since 2019.
The quiz covers trending stories in Greater Boston, including local events and news.

title: MBTA Hingham ferry service canceled for Feb. 13 due to ice in the harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA cancels Hingham/Hull ferry service on Feb. 13 due to thick ice in Boston Harbor.
Shuttle buses will replace ferry services, running between Nantasket Beach and Hull Ferry Terminal.
Thick ice cancellations are rare, last occurring 8-10 years ago, per MBTA's ferry operations director.

title: Retired Gloucester firefighter dies days after being struck by Lowell police cruiser
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Retired Gloucester firefighter Daniel Kennedy died after being struck by a Lowell police cruiser at UMass Lowell.
The incident occurred on Wilder Street near the McGauvran Center; Kennedy was hospitalized before succumbing to his injuries.
Massachusetts State Police and Middlesex DA are investigating the crash; Kennedy was a recently enrolled UMass student.

title: 5 players on Red Sox’ roster bubble entering spring training
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Triston Casas, recovering from a knee injury, may start the 2026 season with Triple-A Worcester instead of the Red Sox.
Kristian Campbell, after a mixed performance in 2025, is expected to begin 2026 in the minors due to defensive issues.
Pitching prospects Payton Tolle and Connelly Early may not make the opening day roster due to competition among Red Sox pitchers.
